title: Missing Security Headers
description:
The amortization calculator endpoint is missing critical security headers that should be present on all HTTP responses. Notable missing headers include: X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS), and Content-Security-Policy (CSP). These headers provide defense-in-depth protection against various web attacks even if other vulnerabilities exist.

X-Content-Type-Options prevents MIME-sniffing attacks where browsers might execute HTML as JavaScript. X-Frame-Options prevents clickjacking attacks by restricting whether the page can be framed. X-XSS-Protection provides XSS protections in older browsers. Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) prevents downgrade attacks and ensures encrypted HTTPS connections. Content-Security-Policy (CSP) prevents injected scripts and restricts resource loading to trusted sources.
impact:
1. Missing X-Content-Type-Options: Browser might MIME-sniff responses, treating HTML as JavaScript or other executable content
2. Missing X-Frame-Options: Application can be framed by malicious sites, enabling clickjacking attacks
3. Missing X-XSS-Protection: Older browsers won't have XSS protection enabled for filter bypasses
4. Missing HSTS: No protection against man-in-the-middle attacks via HTTP downgrade attacks
5. Missing CSP: No protection against injected scripts or unauthorized resource loading
6. Financial data transmission lacks multiple layers of defense, increasing risk of session hijacking and data theft
evidence:
HTTP Response Headers Analysis verified by executing POC:

Command: curl -i 'http://localhost/amortization?term=5'

Response Headers Present:
- HTTP/1.1 200 OK
- Date: Fri, 07 Nov 2025 18:22:15 GMT
- Server: Apache/2.4.65 (Debian)
- Content-Length: 1598
- Cache-Control: public, max-age=0
- Pragma: no-cache
- Expires: 0
- Vary: Accept-Encoding
- Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

Response Headers Missing (Security-related):
- ❌ X-Content-Type-Options
- ❌ X-Frame-Options
- ❌ X-XSS-Protection
- ❌ Strict-Transport-Security
- ❌ Content-Security-Policy

POC Execution Result: VULNERABILITY CONFIRMED - All 5 critical security headers are missing from the response
remediation:
1. Add X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header to prevent MIME-sniffing attacks
2. Add X-Frame-Options: DENY header (or SAMEORIGIN if framing by same-origin is required) to prevent clickjacking
3. Add X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block header for XSS protection in older browsers
4. Add Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload header for HSTS protection
5. Add Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' header to restrict resource loading
6. Implement headers in Apache configuration using mod_headers module (/etc/apache2/mods-enabled/headers.conf or within VirtualHost)
7. Alternatively, implement in application middleware/response handlers if using application-level framework
8. Test headers using curl or online tools like https://securityheaders.com
9. Verify headers are present on all endpoints of the application
10. Document security header policy and maintenance procedures
references: CWE-693: Protection Mechanism Failure, OWASP A01:2021 – Broken Access Control, OWASP Security Headers Reference, RFC 7034 (X-Frame-Options), RFC 6797 (HTTP Strict Transport Security)
toolCallDescription: Documenting missing security headers finding with working POC verification
